FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Alta-Dena Certified Dairy is not only committed to offer a superior product, but to also maintain safety and environmental programs which promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding community.  The Environmental Health and Safety Manager administers the facility's safety and environmental policies.  The Safety/Environmental Manager periodically evaluates the health and safety practices of facility employees to ensure forklift safety, hazard communications, lockout/tagout, Hazardous Materials Emergency Business Plan, employee safety manuals, manufacturer's documentation, Emergency Action Plan as well as the Process Safety Management and Risk Management Plans are carried out.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



Alta-Dena Certified Dairy makes high quality dairy products with unrivaled flavor, quality, freshness and nutrition.  All our milk comes from California dairy farms.



Alta-Dena Certified Dairy uses a regulated substance (Anhydrous Ammonia as a refrigerant in the refrigeration system) in order to cool the milk during processing and to maintain the milk at a cold temperature while being handled in the milk coolers.  Anhydrous ammonia is an environmentally friendly and efficient chemical to use for refrigeration.  The anhydrous ammonia is contained within a closed-loop refrigeration system.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The facility complies with the following risk management regulations:



1)  OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM),

2)  EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) and

3)  OES California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program.



These regulations impose numerous requirements on the facility to ensure the safety of the public and on-site employees.  The following summarizes the key compliance programs that have been implemented by Alta-Dena Certified Dairy to prevent accidental release of anhydrous ammonia from the facility.  Written Operating Procedures

are used for training and to ensure that procedures are accurate and uniform with all operators.  Operators are trained in-house and on the job as well as completing local RETA classes and ammonia refrigeration courses at the University of Wisconsin or similar institutions.  The mechanical integrity program ensures that the ammonia refrigeration system is in proper working condition based upon routine checks, tests and inspections.  The Management of Change procedures are to ensures that process modifications are based on sound design principles and implemented in a safe manner.  A Pre-Startup Safety Review procedure is utilized as a check prior to ammonia being introduced into new equipment to be assured that the Management of Change procedures are completed.  A Hot Work Permit program ensures that Hot Work procedures are followed if Alta-Dena Certified Dairy employees or contractors are to perform hot work.  Contractors safety programs and records are evaluated.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There were no accidents involving the ammonia refrigeration system during the past five years.



EMERGENCY ACTION PLANS



The facility would utilized the Los Angeles County Fire Department as an Emergency Responder.
